page.title: 16THE KNOCKAHOLLET MOTTE
page.content: In our area there is a{motte and {bailey fort.}The motte is a big mound of earth, and the bailey is a ring of earth all round the motte. This fort was built by a Norman knight,{Sir John {de Courcy,}as his men marched north through this area around the{year {1200.} At that time, the natives of Co. Antrim would have attacked Sir John so the Normans built these forts for protection. They always put them on a hill with a good view in all directions so that the natives could be watched. The sides were steep and , at first, there was a high fence all round the top. There are a number of these forts in Co. Antrim, but the one in our area is well preserved.
